sen.j: 真言律宗（しんごんりっしゅう）は、真言密教の宗義に基づいて金剛乗の戒律を修学する一派。
sen.e: Shingon Risshu sect is one sect which practice commandments of Vajrayana based on the dharma of Shingon Mikkyo.
Shingon Risshu sect is one sect which practices the commandments of Vajrayana based on the dharma of Shingon Mikkyo.
Shingon Risshu sect is one sect which practices the commandments of Vajrayana based on the dharma of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 用語を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 南都六宗の1つである律宗精神の再興の意義も併せて有している。
sen.e: It also has significance of renaissance of the Risshu sect's sprit, which is one of the six sects of Buddhism brought to Japan during the Nara period.
It also has the significance of renaissance of the Risshu sect's sprit, which is one of the six sects of Buddhism brought to Japan during the Nara period.
It also has the significance of renaissance of the Risshu sect's sprit, which is one of the Nanto rokushu (the six sects of Buddhism which flourished in ancient Nara).
sen.cmt: 用語を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 宗祖
sen.e: Founder of the sect
Founder of the sect
Founder of the Sect

sen.j: 西大寺 (奈良市)の興正菩薩叡尊を中興の祖とする。
sen.e: Kosei Bosatsu Eison of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City is the restorer.
Kosei Bosatsu Eison of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City is the restorer.
Kosei Bosatsu Eison of Saidai-ji Temple in Nara City was the restorer.

sen.j: なお、空海を高祖として特に仰いでいる。
sen.e: In addition, it regards Kukai as Koso (a founder) especially.
In addition, it regards Kukai as Koso (a founder) especially.
In addition, it especially regards Kukai as Koso (a founder).

sen.j: 叡尊は荒廃した既存仏教に対する批判から律宗の覚盛とともにこれまで国家が定めた手続きによる方法しか認められていなかった授戒を自らの手で行った（自誓授戒）。
sen.e: Eison implemented Jukai (handing down the precepts), which procedure was limited to what had been defined by state, by himself with Kakujo in Risshu sect because he criticized the degraded existing Buddhism (vow by oneself and Jukai).

Eison implemented Jukai (handing down the precepts), a procedure which was limited to what had been defined by the state, by himself with Kakujo in the Risshu sect because he criticized the degraded existing Buddhism (vow by oneself and Jukai).

Eison implemented Jukai (handing down the precepts), a procedure which was limited to what had been defined by the state, by himself with Kakujo in the Risshu sect because he criticized the degraded existing Buddhism (vow by oneself and Jukai).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: その後、戒律に対する考え方の違いから覚盛と一線を画するが、彼の依頼による西大寺 (奈良市)再興を引き受けて、続いて法華寺・般若寺などの再興に従事して、朝廷の許可なくして独自の戒壇を設置した。
sen.e: After that he made a clear distinction from Kakujo because of the difference on the idea of commandments, but he accepted Kakujo's request to restore Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), engaged in the restoration of temples such as Hokke-ji Temple and Hannya-ji Temple subsequently, and placed independent Kaidan, Buddhist ordination platform without permission of Imperial Court.

After that he made a clear distinction from Kakujo because of differences in the idea of commandments, but he accepted Kakujo's request to restore Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), engaged in the restoration of temples such as Hokke-ji Temple and Hannya-ji Temple subsequently, and an placed independent Kaidan, Buddhist ordination platform without the permission of the Imperial Court.

After that he made a clear distinction from Kakujo because of differences in the idea of commandments, but he accepted Kakujo's request to restore Saidai-ji Temple (Nara City), engaged in the restoration of temples such as Hokke-ji Temple and Hannya-ji Temple subsequently, and an placed independent Kaidan (Buddhist ordination platform) without the permission of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 用語を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 続いて弟子の忍性が登場して叡尊が十分に達せられなかった民衆への布教に才覚を示して、鎌倉に極楽寺 (鎌倉市)を建立した。
sen.e: Continuously, his disciple Ninsho appeared and built Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kamakura City, showing the wit of propagandism against people, which Enson could not have achieved fully.
Continuously, his disciple Ninsho appeared and built Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kamakura City, showing the wit of propagandism against the people, which Enson could not have achieved fully.
Continuously, his disciple Ninsho appeared and built Gokuraku-ji Temple in Kamakura City, showing the wit of propagandism against the people, which Eison could not have achieved fully.

sen.j: これが真言律宗の起源であるが、当初叡尊自身やその門人は真言宗の再興の一環として律宗再興を図ったものであり、自らを真言宗の一派である「西大寺流」として規定して行動していた。
sen.e: This is the origin of Shingon Risshu sect, but at that time Eison himself and his disciples tried to restore Risshu sect as a part of renaissance of Shingon sect and they identified themselves as 'Saidai-ji Temple group,' one group of Shingon sect.

This is the origin of the Shingon Risshu sect, but at that time Eison himself and his disciples tried to restore the Risshu sect as a part of renaissance of the Shingon sect and they identified themselves as the 'Saidai-ji Temple group,' one group of the Shingon sect.

This is the origin of the Shingon Risshu sect, but at that time Eison himself and his disciples tried to restore the Risshu sect as a part of renaissance of the Shingon sect and they identified themselves as the 'Saidai-ji Temple school,' one school of the Shingon sect.

sen.j: しかし、当時においては律宗の新派と見られていた。
sen.e: However, at that time it was considered as a new group of Risshu sect.
However, at that time it was considered as a new group of the Risshu sect.
However, at that time it was considered as a new school of the Risshu sect.

sen.j: なお、叡尊の行動は通説では旧仏教内部からの改革運動と位置づけられているが、近年ではこれを真言宗・律宗の枠を超えた新宗派であるとして鎌倉新仏教の1つと見る説もある（鎌倉仏教参照）。
sen.e: Besides, although Eison's activities are generally seen as a reform movement inside old Buddhism, recently there is a theory that it was a new sect beyond the frames of Shingon sect and Risshu sect and one of the new Kamakura Buddhism (See the article of Kamakura Buddhism).

Besides, although Eison's activities are generally seen as a reform movement inside old Buddhism, recently there is a theory that it was a new sect beyond the frames of the Shingon sect and the Risshu sect and one of the new Kamakura Buddhism (See the article of Kamakura Buddhism).

Besides, although Eison's activities are generally seen as a reform movement inside old Buddhism, recently there is a theory that it was a new sect beyond the frames of the Shingon sect and the Risshu sect and one of the new Kamakura Buddhism (See the article of Kamakura Buddhism).

sen.j: 後継者である信空 (真言律宗)・忍性は朝廷の信任が厚く、諸国の国分寺再建（勧進）を命じられてこれを末寺化するなど、教派の拡大に努めた。
sen.e: His successor Shinku (Shingon Risshu sect) and Ninsho gained the confidence from Imperial Court and made efforts to widespread the influence of sect as they made provincial monasteries branch temples for restoration (temple solicitation) by Imperial order.

His successor Shinku (Shingon Risshu sect) and Ninsho gained the confidence of the Imperial Court and made efforts to broaden the influence of the sect as they made provincial monasteries branch temples for restoration (temple solicitation) by Imperial order.

His successor Shinku (Shingon Risshu sect) and Ninsho gained the confidence of the Imperial Court and made efforts to broaden the influence of the sect as they made provincial monasteries branch temples for restoration (temple solicitation) by Imperial order.

sen.j: 自身に厳格で寺院再建のノウハウを積んだ真言律宗の僧侶主導の勧進活動に対する評価の上昇はやがて他の律宗諸派再興の動きを促し、一時は真言律宗を含めた律宗は禅宗・浄土宗などと勢力を分けて日蓮より「律国賊」との非難を受けるほどであった。
sen.e: Activities for temple solicitation led by priests of Shingon Risshu sect were recognized highly because they were strict by themselves and had know-how of temple restoration, which soon promoted the movement of renaissance of other Risshu sects so much as Risshu sect including Shingon Risshu sect was criticized by Nichiren as 'Ritsu traitor to the country,' having the same power of influence as Zen sect and Jodo sect.

Activities for temple solicitation led by priests of the Shingon Risshu sect were well recognized because they were strict by themselves and had know-how of temple restoration, which soon promoted the movement of renaissance of other Risshu sects so much so that the Risshu sect, including the Shingon Risshu sect, was criticized by Nichiren as 'Ritsu traitor to the country,' having the same power of influence as the Zen sect and the Jodo sect.

Activities for temple solicitation led by priests of the Shingon Risshu sect were well recognized because they were strict by themselves and had know-how of temple restoration, which soon promoted the movement of renaissance of other Risshu sects so much so that the Risshu sect, including the Shingon Risshu sect, was criticized by Nichiren as 'Ritsu traitor to the country,' having the same power of influence as the Zen sect and the Jodo sect.

sen.j: 室町時代後期以後一時衰微したものの、江戸時代前期の明忍が再興の動きを見せ、その門人にあたる浄厳は初めて公に「真言律宗」という名乗りを用いた。
sen.e: Although it declined temporarily after the latter part of Muromachi Period, Myonin tried to restore it at the early part of Edo Period and his student Jogon used the title of 'Shingon Risshu sect' formally for the first time.

Although it declined temporarily after in the latter part of the Muromachi Period, Myonin tried to restore it during the early part of the Edo Period and his student Jogon used the title of 'Shingon Risshu sect' formally for the first time.

Although it declined temporarily after in the latter part of the Muromachi period, Myonin tried to restore it during the early part of the Edo period and his disciple Jogon used the title of 'Shingon Risshu sect' formally for the first time.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）、明治政府は諸宗派の整理を断行、その際律宗系最大の勢力であった真言律宗が元は真言宗の流れを汲むことから全律宗諸派が真言宗に組み入れられた。
sen.e: When Meiji Government organized various sects in 1872, all Risshu sects were incorporated into Shingon sect because the biggest sect among Risshu sects at that time originated from Shingon sect.

When the Meiji Government organized various sects in 1872, all Risshu sects were incorporated into the Shingon sect because the biggest sect among Risshu sects at that time originated from the Shingon sect.

When the Meiji Government organized various sects in 1872, all Risshu sects were incorporated into the Shingon sect because Shingon Risshu sect which was the biggest sect among Risshu sects at that time, originated from the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 真言律宗が、を補足しました。

sen.j: その後、律宗系諸派はいずれも真言宗からの独立を求め、西大寺でも佐伯弘澄（64世長老）が運動を行った。
sen.e: After that, groups of Risshu sect requested the independence from Shingon sect, for example Kocho SAEKI (Hirosumi SAEKI) (the 64th elder chief priest) of Saidai-ji Temple carried on a campaign.
After that, groups of the Risshu sect requested independence from the Shingon sect, for example Kocho SAEKI (Hirosumi SAEKI) (the 64th elder chief priest) of Saidai-ji Temple carried on a campaign.
After that, schools of the Risshu sect requested independence from the Shingon sect, for example Kocho SAEKI (Hirosumi SAEKI) (the 64th choro (patriarch)) of Saidai-ji Temple carried on a campaign.

sen.j: その甲斐があり、1895年（明治28年）に律宗系の諸派は真言宗からの独立を許されて、その際に真言律宗も真言宗から独立する。
sen.e: Rewarding this movement, groups of Risshu sect were permitted to become independent from Shingon sect in 1895, and Shingon Risshu sect also gained independence from Shingon sect at that time.

Rewarding this movement, groups of the Risshu sect were permitted to become independent from the Shingon sect in 1895, and the Shingon Risshu sect also gained independence from the Shingon sect at that time.

Rewarding this movement, schools of the Risshu sect were permitted to become independent from the Shingon sect in 1895, and the Shingon Risshu sect also gained independence from the Shingon sect at that time.

sen.j: ただし、明治以前真言律宗であった寺院の中には独立に従わずに真言宗寺院としての道を歩んだものもあった。
sen.e: However, some temples which had been Shingon Risshu sect temples before Meiji Period, remained as Shingon sect temples without following the independent movement.
However, some temples which had been Shingon Risshu sect temples before the Meiji Period remained as Shingon sect temples without following the independent movement.
However, some temples which had been Shingon Risshu sect temples before the Meiji period remained as Shingon sect temples without following the independent movement.

sen.j: 以後、西大寺を総本山としてその住職である西大寺長老が真言律宗管長を兼務する慣例となっている。
sen.e: After that, the elder chief priest of Saidai-ji Temple, the Grand Head Temple, has doubled as the chief abbot of Shingon Risshu sect as customary.
After that, the elder chief priest of Saidai-ji Temple, the Grand Head Temple, doubled as the chief abbot of the Shingon Risshu sect as a custom.
After that, the choro of Saidai-ji Temple who is the head priest of Saidai-ji Temple as sohonzan (the general head temple) doubled as the chief abbot of the Shingon Risshu sect as a custom.
sen.cmt: その住職である、を補足して総本山の表記を変えました。（大本山と区別するため）

sen.j: 別格本山 一之室院（塔頭）、護国院（塔頭）、称名寺 (横浜市)（横浜市金沢区）、教興寺（大阪府八尾市）、久修園院（枚方市）、伊予国分寺（愛媛県今治市）、法華寺（今治市）、蓮華寺誕生寺（熊本県玉名市）
sen.e: Bekkaku-honzan, Special Head Temple: Ichinomuro-in Temple (Tacchu, A simple building containing a pagoda that enshrined the ashes of a founder or head priest of a Zen temple), Gokoku-in Temple (Tacchu), Shomyo-ji Temple (Kanazawa Ward Yokohama City), Kyoko-ji Temple (Yao City Osaka Prefecture), Kushuon-in Temple (Hirakata City), Iyo provincial monastery (Imabari City Ehime Prefecture), Hokke-ji Temple (Imabari City) and Rengein Tanjo-ji Temple (Tamana City Kumamoto Prefecture)

sen.e: Bekkaku-honzan, Special Head Temple: Ichinomuro-in Temple (Tacchu, A simple building containing a pagoda that enshrined the ashes of a founder or head priest of a Zen temple), Gokoku-in Temple (Tacchu), Shomyo-ji Temple (Kanazawa Ward Yokohama City), Kyoko-ji Temple (Yao City Osaka Prefecture), Kushuon-in Temple (Hirakata City), Iyo provincial monastery (Imabari City Ehime Prefecture), Hokke-ji Temple (Imabari City) and Rengein Tanjo-ji Temple (Tamana City Kumamoto Prefecture)

Bekkaku-honzan (special head temple): Ichinomuroin Temple (Tacchu, A simple building containing a pagoda that enshrined the ashes of a founder or head priest of a Zen temple), Gokokuin Temple (Tacchu), Shomyo-ji Temple (Kanazawa-ku Ward, Yokohama City), Kyoko-ji Temple (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture), Kushuonin Temple (Hirakata City), Iyo provincial monastery temples (Imabari City, Ehime Prefecture), Hokke-ji Temple (Imabari City) and Tanjo-ji Temple of Renge-ji Temple (Tamana City, Kumamoto Prefecture)
sen.cmt: ・・・院の表記を変え、「蓮華寺誕生寺」は「蓮華院誕生寺」の誤記と思われますが、指示書に従い、「蓮華寺誕生寺」としました。
